banner.title: 844 MILLION PEOPLE
banner.desc: IN THE WORLD LIVE WITHOUT ACCESS TO CLEAN WATER
banner.content: Water is a fundamental human need and a driver for sustainable growth, yet water scarcity affects more than 40% of the global population and is projected to rise. While 2.6 billion people have gained access to improved drinking water sources since 1990, yet 844 million people are still struggling with water sources.

facts.title: FACTS
facts.desc: Statistics can look stark. But we believe that we can challenge those odds thanks to our donors and implementing partners. With their help, we have already served millions of people with access to clean and safe water in some of the driest and toughest places in the world.

fact_widgets.desc: 31% of schools don’t have clean water.

fact_widgets.title: 2.3B
fact_widgets.desc: 2.3 billion people don’t have a decent toilet.
By 2025, half of the world’s population will be living in water-stressed areas.
Every minute a newborn dies from infection caused by lack of safe water and an unclean environment.
